intro: Anil parkeri, commonly known as the African violet, is a flowering plant native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the family Gesneriaceae and is characterized by its fleshy, tuberous roots and rosette-shaped leaves. The plant produces showy, bell-shaped flowers in shades of purple, pink, and white. It thrives in well-drained soil and requires bright, indirect light for optimal growth. Anil parkeri is popular as a houseplant due to its ornamental value and relatively easy care requirements.
